fields.description:
This is repeatable every time and only happens when using IE (v6sp2 and v7). Does not happen in Firefox. Create a wiki page that has a scaffolding macro and a dynamictasklist macro. Save it, add some labels, edit it. Select Edit Layout or just Edit the page, the labels are immediately deleted. This does not occur when using the macros individually.

*Example wiki page:*
{noformat}
{text-data:StoryId|type=line|required=true|width=500px}{text-data}
{dynamictasklist:Story Tasking|sortAscending=false|sortBy=priority}{dynamictasklist}
{noformat}

*Plugin Versions in use:*
_Dynamic Task List 2 Plugin_
Vendor: Atlassian Software Systems Pty Ltd
Plugin Version: 2.2

_Scaffolding Plugin_
Vendor: CustomWare Asia Pacific
Plugin Version: 2.3-dr7

In IE7, when using the two macros together I encountered a script error every time when trying to edit the page. Upon debugging it, I found the offending line as per shown in the attached picture below in yellow.

I also tested _Confluence 2.6.2_ with _Scaffolding plugin 2.6-dr8_ and _Dynamic Task List 2 Plugin 2.2_ and was unable to reproduce the problem.
fields.summary: Labels are deleted when editing a page in Internet Explorer that uses DynamicTasklist macro with Scaffolding

fields.description:
We did some load testing on our customized confluence installation. We are using conveyor to override existing xwork actions (e.g. the alphalist implementation provided by atlassian fetches *all* page objects of a space, does some permission filtering in memory and finally identifies the portion to present to the user. In case of a *high* number of page objects, this might not be an appropriate solution). Our conveyor plug-ins are spread over several plug-in archives.

The confluence xwork object factory implementation responsible to create new xwork action instances delegates the class lookup task to the ConfluencePluginObjectFactory and the _PluginsClassLoader_. Actually the _ConfluencePluginObjectFactory_ class cycles for every xwork action class resolution through all plug-in classloader and ask them for the class instance. Every time a class is not present as part of an plug-in a _ClassNotFoundException_ is thrown and the next plug-in is asked. So quite a number of exception might be generated. In addition there is this synchronized  _loadClass(..)_ method in _PluginsClassLoader_. In case confluence is under heavy load and the xwork action to resolve is served in our test scenario by the 20th plug-in, we observed that the xwork class resolution was delayed in worst case about *1s*!! The main reason is that several threads are waiting for the loadClass method monitor.

(I assume that this problem is also present in case of xwork plug-ins.)

Please find attached a patched _ConfluencePluginObjectFactory_ which helped us to solve the problem. This patch is using a cache to identify the plug-in classloader which may serve the class resolution.

It would be very helpful when atlassian would incorporate this patch in the next release (or find a even better solution for this performance problem.)
fields.summary: Bad performance Objectfactory/PlugInClassLoader Xwork action class resolution

fields.description:
My user lost code inside an XML block in a comment when editing in Firefox. 
The code in the original comment looked like this:
I might even go so far as to allow for delimited sections (in which XML may be a better choice) so that there's less chance for confusion. _I.e._ if 400 lines down, someone accidentally deletes the second '1' in p11, they've reset something up here that was unintentional. Something like
\\
{code:xml}
<environmentalPolicySettings
        friendlyName="Java Key Stores (1)"
        oldId = "uuidl:1900234">
  <decryptionKeySpec>
    <location/>
    <credentials/>
    <type/>
    <keyAccess>*
      <name/>
      <credentials/>
    </keyAccess>
  </decryptionKeySpec>
</environmentalPolicySettings>
{code}

When the user attempted to re-edit this comment (in either Rich Text or Wiki Markup mode), some of the XML in the code block disappeared, so that it looked like this:
\\ I might even go so far as to allow for delimited sections (in which XML may be a better choice) so that there's less chance for confusion. _I.e._ if 400 lines down, someone accidentally deletes the second '1' in p11, they've reset something up here that was unintentional.  Something like
\\
{code:xml}
"Java Key Stores (1)"
        oldId = "uuidl:1900234">




    *
{code}

Only the attributes of the first element in the XML and the asterisk from the element <keyAccess> seems to have been retained.

I was unable to reproduce this in my own Firefox browser when editing the same comment. Perhaps this was due to the version of Firefox, or to the plug-ins installed on this user's Firefox browser? I will submit the list of these plug-ins separately once the user sends them to me.
fields.summary: XML code disappears from inside {code} macro in a comment when user edits

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-11194].
  {panel}

Confluence needs to support opening a link in a new window.  

Although I admit that it probably shouldn't use target as that's deprecated, it should still do it (article on standards compliant way: http://www.sitepoint.com/article/standards-compliant-world).

Wordpress does it and I use it all the time.  Within a week of us rolling out Confluence at my company, people have started asking for it.  

I am aware of the CONF-1210, CONF-7045, and CONF-6947 marked "Will not fix," but this is a simple feature found in competing products which users find useful and I wanted to open it again and get votes behind it.

The {link-to} macro doesn't do this for external links so it doesn't satisfy this requirement.

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of September 19, 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA} 
Hi everyone, 

Thank you for your ongoing feedback on this issue. On behalf of the Confluence team I would like to apologize for the changing status of this request. After many hours of discussion with design and product management, and after some engineering prototyping and testing, we have decided to close this issue as we do not plan to release this feature.

We aim to make our users' experience as friction-free as possible, and although being able to control the ways of opening links would be useful to many of you, it could easily lead to an inconsistent experience for users.

If your use of Confluence is in fact enhanced by opening particular links in a new window/tab then please consider using one of the existing solutions from our Marketplace (unfortunately they're not available for Cloud instances): 

* [ServiceRocket Linking Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/net.customware.confluence.plugin.linking]
* [External Link Add-on|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/ch.bitvoodoo.confluence.plugins.externallinks]

Cheers,

Adam Barnes
Confluence Product Manager
{panel}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-11189].
  {panel}

After upgrading to Confluence 2.7.1, emails sent to users who use Microsoft Entourage 2008 (Macintosh) as their email client sometimes (maybe always) show up blank.  A look at the actual message (using Message->Source in Entourage menu) reveals that the message contains all of the right data. The same message on the IMAP server downloaded to alternate email clients (including MS Outlook on a PC, iPhone Mail, and Apple Mail) renders correctly.

There is however another user who has reported the same problem with MS Outlook, though this is not consistent with other users. At least two users using Microsoft Entourage at our site are receiving the 'blank' emails. Saving the message in its original format using Entourage again reveals that the contents of the message are there in the message.

A hunch that this problem was an HTML display problem led me to edit the message and remove all of the stylesheet information (removing the {{<style>...</style>}} elements from the HTML inside the message. Sure enough, that edited email message displayed correctly in Entourage.  Also, switching to 'Text' format for notification emails allows the emails to be viewed, providing further evidence the problem is an HTML display issue only.

So it seems that the problem is with Microsoft Entourage (latest update to MS Office/Entourage 12.0.1 didn't fix the issue). However, the fact that it seems to occur on at least one instance of MS Outlook leads me to believe that perhaps something in the underlying stylesheet could be adjusted to work with Entourage and Outlook reliably.  If the stylesheet could be updated so that it renders properly in Entourage (probably some minor bug in Entourage/MS Office HTML rendering), this would be most desirable.
fields.summary: Daily update emails won't display in MS Entourage

fields.description:
One of our new recruits accidentally moved our user guides home page and all child pages to another space. Mid way through the move process, he realised his mistake and clicked cancel - the effect was disastrous.

Some of the pages were moved to the target space, but the source space (our user guides) was left completely empty - or so it seems.  When we tried moving the page tree back to the user guides space, it says that some pages already exist (yet we can't see them) and asks to rename them. We tried renaming but it just keeps coming up with the "some pages already exist" error and so on.

In short, cancelling a mass page move leads to lots and lots of pain. If it's cancelled then it should stop in a stable state where we can move pages back to the source space.
fields.summary: Cancelling a mass page move corrupts database

fields.description:
The social bookmarking plugin is bundled in Confluence 2.7.x and Confluence 2.6.x. As such this vulnerability affects all 2.7.x and 2.6.x instances (even if you do not use the plugin or do not have the *Add Bookmark Web Item* enabled). 

The {{updatebookmark.action}} URL is vulnerable on these parameters: 

- bookmarkPageId
- redirect
- labelsString

The JIRA issue created in the developer.atlassian.com project for this plugin can be found here: http://developer.atlassian.com/jira/browse/MARK-60.
fields.summary: XSS vulnerability in social bookmarking plugin bundled in Confluence

fields.description:
If a single user has a null email address, no further daily reports will be sent.

The log file will contain warning similar to the following:
{noformat}
2008-11-27 16:04:00,375 WARN [DefaultQuartzScheduler_Worker-5] [confluence.mail.jobs.DailyReportJob] doExecute Not sending notification email [ Confluence Changes in the last 24 hours+ ] to [ John Doe ]:  No email set
{noformat}

Some users might still receive the email update, but when Confluence try to send an email to John Doe (who does not have an email) it will log the warning above and stop sending email.

Hence the rest of the recipients in the {{Confluence Changes in the last 24 Hours}} list will not receive the digest mail.
fields.summary: User with null email address breaks daily report job

fields.description:
I was doing an upgrade from 2.5.6 to 2.8-m7-r2 which did not work: I could log in with my user but I did not have administrator privileges.

It turned out that I had to put back the original settings into atlassian-user.xml:

{noformat}
        <!-- Default confluence user repository -->
        <osuser key="osuserRepository" name="OSUser Repository"/>
        <!--
        <hibernate name="Hibernate Repository" key="hibernateRepository"  description="Hibernate Repository" cache="true"/>
        -->
{noformat}

After that everything was just fine. It seems that only users have been migrated to hibernate, but not groups.

Confluence should detect whether a backup or existing data uses the osuser method or hibernate method, and either migrate both tables, or use the corresponding atlassian-user.xml file.
fields.summary: No admin privileges after upgrading to 2.8

fields.description:
Improvement Issue [http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-8010|CONF-8010] has been implemented with the result that spacekeys are not shown anymore in cross-space links. However, I consider its present implementation in v2.7.1 as a defect, since the former link behavior has not been respected, and no option has been allowed for backward compatibility.

Under v2.3.1, our procedure for creating new pages relied on a first "draft" step where the user would:
# create the draft page in their own personal space
# create an unaliased link from the global (production) space concerned, pointing to the draft page in the personal space

The link created in the global space would then show as:
{{~userid:Draft Page Title}}
-- the spacekey, in this case, being '~userid', with the advantages that:
* this showed at first glance that it was a link to a DRAFT note, since it obviously pointed to a user space
* if the user renamed the draft page, the link name would automatically be updated
* when the user moved the (no longer) draft page to the appropriate global space, the spacekey '~userid' would disappear
* once the page moved, it was clear at first glance that the link pointed to a 'production' note, not a draft

This feature is now lost in v2.7.1, and I have no option to have the proper link behavior reappear in my installation, which now makes our page-creation procedure inappropriate.

As a workaround, I've been proposed to copy the full 'Link' contents to the 'Alias' field of the 'Link Properties' dialogue. This workaround is NOT functional, for 2 reasons:
# it doesn't work in the Rich Text Editor:
## if your link is {{spacekey:The page name}} and you copy it into the Alias, the alias disappears as soon as you confirm 'Link Properties' data
## the wiki markup then shows {{\[spacekey:The page name\]}}, and the link just displays as 'The page name'
# if you create the link in the Wiki Markup Editor, it "works" in the sense that the Alias stays and the link is displayed with the spacekey, BUT:
## if you modify the destination page name OR move the page to a different space (as we do in our page creation procedure), then the alias is NOT updated, since it's been hardcoded
## if you modify the destination page name, the wiki markup yielded is:
### BEFORE: {{\[spacekey:The old page name\|spacekey:The old page name\]}}
### AFTER: {{\[spacekey:The NEW page name\|spacekey:The old page name\]}}
>> and the link displays as 'spacekey: The old page name'
## if you move the page, for instance to the appropriate global space, the wiki markup yielded is:
### BEFORE: {{\[oldspacekey:The page name\|oldspacekey:The page name\]}}
### AFTER: {{\[NEWspacekey:The page name\|oldspacekey:The page name\]}}
>> and the link displays as 'oldspacekey: The page name'

As it was first suggested in [http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-8010|CONF-8010], the following should be implemented as a fix to this issue:

{quote}
create a configuration item "Show space keys for inter-space links by default". Default to 'true' for backward compatibility
{quote}

NOTE: In my installation, Issue [http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-10458] has now been fixed as suggested with [https://repository.atlassian.com/maven2/com/atlassian/renderer/atlassian-renderer/3.18/atlassian-renderer-3.18.jar] in order to resolve broken links problems, but I'm still left with the above issue.
fields.summary: Cross-space links omit spacekey with no backward compatibility option (lost feature)

I go to a page I want to bookmark in Confluence. I click in the toolbar's shorcut; the 'Add Bookmark' page opens; I click 'Save'.
The navigator goes to 'http://www.atlassian.com/atlassian-public-pom/confluence-plugin-base/socialbookmarking' (which doesn't exist) and the bookmark is created !
fields.summary: When you create a bookmark from the browser toolbar, it goes to the site www.atlassian.com when you click 'save'

fields.description:
The jiraissues macro does not work correctly with non-English user accounts. We have custom bug types, priorities and statusses; all translated to German as far as possible. 

This is the jiraissue call in the Confluence page: 
{jiraissues:url=http://my.server.com/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-xml/temp/SearchRequest.xml?&customfield_10071=m1n%2B102a&sorter/field=issuekey&sorter/order=DESC&tempMax=1000}

Jira trusts Confluence. 

View the page as user with preferred language English: Icons are fine (exept the custom bug type "Spezifikationsfrage").
View the page as user with preferred language German: Icons are broken. 
I will attach some screenshots. 

I think it depends on the language preferrences in Jira.
fields.summary: jiraissues icons break for users with different language than English

fields.description: The URL is not encoded in case of group browser. So when you enter Japanese characters and do a search, and navigate to the next page, the Japanese search text looks corrupted. Please see the reproduction sequence attached. This happens on IE6. Example: 次へ >>
fields.summary: URL not encoded for group browser

fields.description:
The error occurs when exporting a page to PDF. The page contains the Include macro that includes another page that has the [Gliffy|http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/Xg0D] diagram.

The steps to reproduce this problem:

# Create a page (named Page A)
# Add a Gliffy diagram to Page A
# Create another page (named Page B)
# Try including Page A by using the "Include macro" in Page B
example:
{noformat}
{include:Page A}
{noformat}
# Try to export Page B (Info->PDF)

You should be able to see the similar error exception in the log file:
{noformat}
2008-03-13 15:12:16,218 ERROR [http-8162-Processor3] [confluence.pages.thumbnail.AbstractThumbnailManager] getThumbnailsFolder Containing folders C:\replicate\confluence\data2.6.2\thumbnails\622601 for the attachment candy box.jpg could not be created

 -- url: /confluence/download/thumbnails/622601/candy%20box.jpg | userName: admin
2008-03-13 15:56:54,811 ERROR [http-8162-Processor4] [gliffy.confluencePlugin.dao.ConfluenceDiagramDAO] getDiagramAsAttachmentByGliffyAccessDescriptor *ERROR* - ContentEntityObject is null!!!

 -- url: /confluence/pages/doexportpage.action | userName: admin | action: doexportpage | page: 1638402
2008-03-13 15:56:54,827 ERROR [http-8162-Processor4] [core.action.client.ClientDiagramImageAction] logThrowable Throwable caught...
Thrown object:java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Short Description:java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Must pass non-null content entity to retrieve latest versions of attachments.
Message:Must pass non-null content entity to retrieve latest versions of attachments.
{noformat}
fields.summary: Gliffy diagram in Include macro breaks PDF export

fields.description:
If you select the _"Remember my login on this computer"_ check box when logging into confluence, trying to log out won't work. The _"you have been logged out"_ screen is displayed but confluence still thinks you are logged in.  If you log out a second time it will then work.

(If you don't select the remember me check box logout works on first attempt.)
fields.summary: Logout on first attempt doesn't work if you set "Remember my login on this computer"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-11078].
  {panel}

It would be nice if confluence used the same mechanism as JIRA regarding the distribution. So instead of downloading a WAR file, you download a tar.gz file which you need to build yourself using a build.sh. I came across this when integrating confluence with crowd and I needed to open the war file myself and needed modify the contents of the war file.

The buildable distribution has the following advantages:

- It is clear what you changed in contrast to the original by using the edit-webapp feature
- You don't have to open and zip up the war file manually, which can be error phrone
- different atlassian products have same distribution
fields.summary: Make Confluence distribution based on same principal as JIRA
Improve performance of web UI by making fewer HTTP requests

fields.description:
Write a JSP that will initialise an empty KEYSTORE table appropriately.
{panel:title=Instructions for running the attached JSP}
 * Shutdown Confluence.
 * Download the [^initKeyStore_5_8.jsp] to your <Confluence INSTALL>/confluence/admin folder.
 * Start Confluence.
 * Open a browser to [http://yourhost.com/admin/initKeyStore_5_8.jsp]
 * Click on the 'Proceed' button.
{panel}
(i) For Confluence 5.7.x or older, please use the [^initKeyStore_4_2.jsp] file instead.
fields.summary: Write JSP to initalise KEYSTORE table

fields.description: It seems the wrapping seen on the screenshots is mainly related to the size of the menu icons and fonts, and to the language settings. Now with smaller fonts, it all looks fine in English, but in French and German it wraps uglily all the time, as can be seen in the screenshot. We need to make some more space there, otherwise non-english languages just don't work.  It sometimes wraps differently, but I guess once we provide more space it should all be fine.
fields.summary: Menus wrap when font size is increased
